unnormalised: **Gas Cylinder Prices Remain Steady, Diwali Celebrations Unaffected…For Now!**
normalised: **Gas Cylinder Prices Remain Steady, Diwali Celebrations Unaffected…For Now!**

unnormalised: Hey everyone, looks like your Diwali mithai-making plans are safe! State-run oil marketing companies haven't touched the price of domestic LPG cylinders this month, keeping the 14.2 kg cylinder steady. In Delhi, you're still looking at around Rs. 1100, give or take a few rupees depending on the retailer.
normalised: Hey everyone, looks like your Diwali mithai-making plans are safe! State-run oil marketing companies haven't touched the price of domestic L P G cylinders this month, keeping the fourteen point two kilogram cylinder steady. In Delhi, you're still looking at around rupee one thousand one hundred, give or take a few rupees depending on the retailer.

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma at the Indian Oil Corp. stated that international crude prices are being monitored closely. This comes as a relief to households in cities like Mumbai and Kolkata, where the cost of living is already sky-high.
normalised: Doctor Sharma at the Indian Oil Corp. stated that international crude prices are being monitored closely. This comes as a relief to households in cities like Mumbai and Kolkata, where the cost of living is already sky-high.

unnormalised: Remember that subsidy scheme? Yeah, that's still a thing for some folks, bringing the effective price down. But for many, especially those living in bigger apartments (1200 sq ft and up!), it's full price all the way.
normalised: Remember that subsidy scheme? Yeah, that's still a thing for some folks, bringing the effective price down. But for many, especially those living in bigger apartments (one thousand two hundred square feet and up!), it's full price all the way.

unnormalised: Analysts are predicting a possible hike after Diwali, so maybe stock up on those extra ladoos now? No one wants a gas price bombshell to spoil the festive cheer! Let's hope things stay put until Chhath Puja, at least! Keep an eye on the headlines folks, things can change faster than you can say "petrol pump"!
normalised: Analysts are predicting a possible hike after Diwali, so maybe stock up on those extra ladoos now? No one wants a gas price bombshell to spoil the festive cheer! Let's hope things stay put until Chhath Puja, at least! Keep an eye on the headlines folks, things can change faster than you can say "petrol pump"!
